dt.t: Higher ground gave the enemy the {wi}advantage{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a factor or circumstance of benefit to its possessor
{bc}benefit resulting from some course of action

dt.t: a mistake which turned out to our {wi}advantage{/wi}

dt: {bc}the first point won in tennis after deuce
{bc}so as to produce a favorable impression or effect

et: alteration (with initial {it}a-{/it} taken as assimilated form of Latin {it}ad-{/it} {et_link|ad-|ad-}) of Middle English {it}avauntage,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French {it}avantage,{/it} from {it}avant{/it} "before" (going back to Latin {it}abante{/it}) + {it}-age{/it} {et_link|-age|-age} {ma}{mat|advance:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a factor or circumstance of benefit to its possessor
benefit, gain; especially : benefit resulting from some course of action

dt.t: Government does not know how to strengthen all families, and no public policy avoids {wi}advantaging{/wi} some families while implicitly asking others to wait in the queue.

et: alteration (after {et_link|advantage:1|advantage:1}) of Middle English {it}avauntagen,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French {it}avauntager,{/it} verbal derivative of {it}avauntage, avantage{/it} {et_link|advantage:1|advantage:1}
shortdef: to give an advantage to : benefit

dt: {bc}the advantage gained by the use of a mechanism in transmitting force
{bc}the ratio of the force that performs the useful work of a machine to the force that is applied to the machine

shortdef: the advantage gained by the use of a mechanism in transmitting force; specifically : the ratio of the force that performs the useful work of a machine to the force that is applied to the machine
